summary: I build, lead and  evolve effective teams. I have deep experience across a variety of working cultures, and a hunger to lead people, improve processes, and create and execute strategy.

profile_positions.description:
- Scaled up a Support team across three offices (Auckland, Minneapolis, Xi'an) and across two products (Travel, Expense)
- Was a core member in 2021 of a project team in a complex and significant endeavour, implementing a new customer service system, Zendesk
- Devised a successful interim strategy at very short notice to ensure the unit not only survives but actively thrives in the COVID landscape
- Achieved increased alignment with the wider business, integrating Support Subject Matter - Experts with Product team value streams. The purpose was to enable more holistic support and increased opportunity for these SMES to grow with the company
- Continuously improved how we worked with a view to decreasing lead times by increasing collaboration
- Redefined role of Support Analyst - from team of generalists to a layered team of Problem Definers, Investigators and SMEs
- Devised and implemented JIT Training program for new hires and for year 1 team members
profile_positions.title: Head of Global Support

profile_positions.description: - Reporting directly to the COO, "held the reins" of leading both the Support and Implementations team during a period of intense growth for the company.
profile_positions.title: Acting Head of Client Services

profile_positions.description:
My move to Auckland has brought with it the exciting opportunity to continue the work I had already carried out in China, and I've continued to manage and coach a diverse and international team of Support Analysts. 

I have continued to propagate the values of lean and continuous improvement.

I'm now able to work alongside members of the Senior Management team based in Auckland, and have been a key contributor in budgeting, recruitment and a variety of management projects.
profile_positions.title: Client Services Manager

profile_positions.description:
The promotion to Client Services Manager has seen me not only increase the effectiveness of my coaching and managing skills, but also take a more active role in interacting with Serko's clients. 

 - Client relationships - I have taken on the Support Management of 3 of our TMC clients.  By holding bi-weekly catch up meetings, and offering a consistent and reliable point of escalation, I have increased Serko's responsiveness to these clients' support requests and increased the clients' overall satisfaction with Serko.  

I have also increased the effectiveness of my managing and coaching skills:

1) Coaching - (a) Have successfully introduced a clear and understandable Coaching Kata (b) Have begun coaching team members in how to coach others (c) Have held fortnightly Coaching Round Tables with the coaches in Serko China where we discuss ideas on how to improve coaching methods. 

2) Goal-setting and Feedback - Rather than annual performance reviews, we hold "Improvement Checkins".  Team members are given ratings across three simple and transparent variables that focus on individual performance, team performance, and readiness for promotion.  Goals are set with the individual's career direction and preferences in mind, and are usually related to broadening their roles into new interesting areas, to learning new skills, or to becoming leaders. All goals are set with an eye to increasing genuine autonomy. 

3) Kanban - I'm passionate about Kanban and am continuously learning things.  As I do, I am in a better position to provide insight to how we work. In recent months in particular, I've led sessions where we've tweaked and changed our Kanban board lanes and policies so as to better cater to our customers, to foster an attitude among the team that "failure" is ok (if a lane or process is not working out, we can just admit failure and make it better) and continuous improvement becomes a tangible activity rather than an abstract wish.
profile_positions.title: Client Services Manager

profile_positions.description:
The promotion to Assistant Manager encompassed the broadening and widening of my previous responsibilities.  As well as continuing with the use of the five pillars of my time as Support Team Leader (Coaching, Experiments, Goal Setting, Agile Driver, Liaising between teams), I also:

1) Took over the management of work outside of Support. My principal success was in improving the Kanban workflow of our Auto-Testing team (focusing on reducing the time some work spent in particularly slow lanes, and on better communication between Testing and Development)

2) Project managed the design and implementation of a new version of our online Support ticketing system.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Manager, China Office

profile_positions.description:
In my time as Support Team Leader, I had five main pillars of my management philosophy:

1) Coaching - Successfully coaching staff members using self-implemented coaching plan in areas of Problem Solving, Critical Thinking, and Effective Time Management.

2) Experiments - Encouraging continuous improvement for both myself and my team by fostering the use of work experiments in the team

3) Goal-Setting and Feedback - Establishing goal setting with team members in conjunction with team members career and life objectives.

4) Kanban - Driving Kanban philosophy for 2 teams, with a focus on limiting WIP for optimising work throughput.

5) Liaising between teams - Acting as an effective liaison between Technical Support and Serko Support Team, helping my Support colleagues to increase their technical knowledge and troubleshooting abilities.
profile_positions.title: Support Team Leader

profile_positions.description:
Developed own detailed spreadsheets to measure personal iSerko call efficiency.  Aggregate “calls closed” at any given time was never lower than 90% of total calls owned. 

Built up my technical knowledge by using SQL, writing queries and scripts, and gaining an understanding of how various Serko databases work.
profile_positions.title: Support Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Working as the sole foreign employee for my company that sends students to the UK to study postgraduate degrees, I singlehandedly established from scratch an IELTS Academic Writing course as a suitable niche product not offered by any of our competitors in the industry.  I regularly marketed this course in presentations to hundreds of clients at a time.

I also offered guidance from a Western perspective in terms of sales and marketing to my Chinese colleagues when required.
profile_positions.title: Education Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Achieved 100% success rate in client agreement and adherence to these newly formulated repayment strategies/loan restructures/work-out arrangements for problem cases. 

Successful account maintenance and reviews on an ongoing basis, i.e. arrears monies and up to date client financial information continually received.  

Consistent adherence to strict deadlines, particularly in preparation of credit reports relating to this portfolio and presentation of same to senior credit committee.
profile_positions.title: Portfolio Executive

profile_positions.description:
Devised, completed and implemented High Level BOSI Fleet Strategy in June 2009. Presented same to senior staff in organisation and to relevant fleet companies. 

Regularly exceeded monthly sales targets, finishing with highest figures of all 60+ Asset Finance sales staff in 2008, and amongst highest “versus target” in 2007. 

Created and maintained key relationships with fleet introducers for entire period despite slowdown in lending activity caused by economic downturn in 2008.
profile_positions.title: Sales Executive

company.name: WWOOF (WORLD WIDE OPPORTUNITIES ON ORGANIC FARMS)

volunteer_experiences.description: Organic farming volunteer in Victoria, Australia
